content: Globally recognized faculty and students collaborate across the campus and around the world to tackle challenges in health care, cybersecurity, big data and transportation. Ongoing research involving software engineering includes: Autonomous systems and robotics, Communications, coding and information theory, Computer architecture and cloud/distributed computing, Data analytics, informatics and machine learning, Embedded systems, Wireless networking, security and systems

Research in autonomous systems and robotics covers the design, development and deployment of intelligent, often safety-critical systems, including unmanned vehicles, robotic manipulators, human-robot interfaces and smart infrastructure. It engages software engineering for real-time control, autonomy algorithms, system integration, verification and validation.

Work in communications, coding and information theory focuses on high-reliability data transmission, network architectures, error-correcting codes and the software and firmware required to support these systems. This area involves engineering of software for distributed communications, cryptographic protocols and efficient code generation for constrained devices.

This focus area addresses software engineering aspects of computer architecture and cloud/distributed computing: designing scalable, resilient, low-latency software systems, virtualization, high-performance computing and software/hardware co-design for emerging platforms.

Data analytics, informatics and machine learning research spans software engineering for large-scale data pipelines, AI/ML model development, deployment and lifecycle management, as well as software for interpreting, visualizing and operationalizing insights from big data.

Embedded systems research involves the development of software that controls hardware in constrained environments (low power, real-time, resource limited). It includes system-level software, firmware, real-time operating systems, IoT devices and integration with larger software ecosystems.

This area focuses on wireless networking, security and systems software engineering: design of secure protocols for wireless/mobile systems, software to support resilient and pervasive connectivity, networked system architectures and the software implications of new wireless technologies.
